subject: Convergence: fix input to check_stack_complete
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-08-23 06:35:46.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/engine/test_check_resource.py', 'heat/engine/check_resource.py'], 'message': 'Convergence: fix input to check_stack_complete

The input to check stack complete should be the resource ID of the
resource that the current resource replaces instead of its own. Failing
to do so will result in stack being in in_progress state for ever.

Change-Id: I6f2856c82c8cc73f628976b7296ab0fb20af5ff3
Closes-Bug: #1614960
'}]
commit_message:
Convergence: fix input to check_stack_complete

The input to check stack complete should be the resource ID of the
resource that the current resource replaces instead of its own. Failing
to do so will result in stack being in in_progress state for ever.

Change-Id: I6f2856c82c8cc73f628976b7296ab0fb20af5ff3
Closes-Bug: #1614960

subject: Do not use env var conf defaults
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-08-12 22:05:06.000000000', 'files': ['heat_integrationtests/common/config.py', 'heat_integrationtests/post_test_hook.sh', 'heat_integrationtests/README.rst', 'tox.ini', 'devstack/upgrade/resources.sh', 'heat_integrationtests/prepare_test_env.sh'], 'message': 'Do not use env var conf defaults

Falling back to environment variable credentials is convenient for
development but could lead to unexpected credentials being used during
tests. Also this is not a known practice for tempest tests.

This change removes the env var defaults and explicitly sets the
credentials to use in prepare_test_env.sh.

Pre and post grenade tests also get their config from the conf file
rather than the environment.

blueprint tempest-plugin-support

Change-Id: Icf9fb4c58ed11483106c2b62d1e1093223f7dc51
'}]
commit_message:
Do not use env var conf defaults

Falling back to environment variable credentials is convenient for
development but could lead to unexpected credentials being used during
tests. Also this is not a known practice for tempest tests.

This change removes the env var defaults and explicitly sets the
credentials to use in prepare_test_env.sh.

Pre and post grenade tests also get their config from the conf file
rather than the environment.

blueprint tempest-plugin-support

Change-Id: Icf9fb4c58ed11483106c2b62d1e1093223f7dc51

commit_message:
Enable TLS for Zaqar API

This adds the zaqar API endpoints to the endpoint environment
variables and allows us to add it to HAProxy; thus, we could enable
TLS for the zaqar API.

Depends-On: If75e2947a2dca95b3e53e1b1ffd93f36fc7fb1cc

commit_message:
Refactor endpoint env variable population

This allows for a more compact view when adding new endpoints and
removes some hardcoded parts such as the internal host and the
internal protocol, which will be useful when TLS support for the
internal endpoints is introduced.

Change-Id: If88959c8344aacdd58cebd5f8ac5865087197ce8

commit_message:
Enable SSL for ironic inspector

This service was not being terminated in HAProxy was always listening
for non-encrypted connections. So we make HAProxy terminate it to be
able to listen for TLS connections.

Change-Id: I5cd6d66056461b487d358efd6bf5bfcd39535736
Closes-Bug: #1595047

subject: Mistral db-populate depends on inspector's endpoint
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-23 11:51:20.000000000', 'files': ['elements/puppet-stack-config/puppet-stack-config.pp'], 'message': "Mistral db-populate depends on inspector's endpoint

In order to do db-populate, mistral creates an instance of the
different openstack clients it supports. Ironic-inspector requires a
running inspector server in order to validate the version, but also
will fetch the server's address from the keystone catalog. So this is
needed before we do db-populate.

Change-Id: I4e44c14c521ad26619a8b73e6974f5ba47924631
"}]
commit_message:
Mistral db-populate depends on inspector's endpoint

In order to do db-populate, mistral creates an instance of the
different openstack clients it supports. Ironic-inspector requires a
running inspector server in order to validate the version, but also
will fetch the server's address from the keystone catalog. So this is
needed before we do db-populate.

Change-Id: I4e44c14c521ad26619a8b73e6974f5ba47924631

commit_message:
Remove pot files

We do not store pot files anymore in repositories,
instead they are published at
http://tarballs.openstack.org/translation-source/watcher/master/ after
each commit and thus always accurate.

Remove the outdated and obsolete file.

commit_message:
Fix credential update to ec2 type

It was possible to create a credential without providing a project_id
and later updating it to the ec2 type.

This patch fixes the issue by adding a manual checking in the
manager layer since it needs to check the old credential contents
prior failing the request.

Change-Id: I1eb28a46c89e17d9c990cc798867d1a59714fe5f
Closes-Bug: #1613466

Patch https://review.openstack.org/#/c/307124/
stash the the old/new pci requests in the
migration context same as we do for NUMA.

This patch is a cleanup patch to deprecate the is_new field
in pci request. The is_new was horrible hack to get the
newer pci request on resize/migration and since the
pci_requests are now stashed in the migration context we

Change-Id: Ie36a74fb2aad9a14a2dc0e0b53649ee770fb2f9d

commit_message:
pci: Deprecate is_new from pci requests

Patch https://review.openstack.org/#/c/307124/
stash the the old/new pci requests in the
migration context same as we do for NUMA.

This patch is a cleanup patch to deprecate the is_new field
in pci request. The is_new was horrible hack to get the
newer pci request on resize/migration and since the
pci_requests are now stashed in the migration context we
can deprecate it.

Change-Id: Ie36a74fb2aad9a14a2dc0e0b53649ee770fb2f9d

commit_message:
Move MySQL settings out of puppet/controller.yaml

This moves the config settings out of controller.yaml for MySQL
and into puppet/services/database/mysql.yaml.

The top leve MysqlRootPassword is still maintained by default
in overcloud.yaml so that users who upgrade won't get
broken. New users may optionally specify the MysqlRootPassword
as a parameter instead which will take priority over the top
level generated parameter.

We drop the top level MysqlClusterUniquePart because it is no
longer used (I think it was a remnant from t-i-e).

Related-Bug: #1604414

Change-Id: I06ebac0f4c87dabfccefb2e550a64650868c5b26

subject: Fixing volume entry definitions
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-08-23 10:21:26.000000000', 'files': ['Docker/Kubernetes/KubernetesCluster/package/Resources/scripts/updateService.sh', 'Docker/Kubernetes/KubernetesCluster/package/Resources/scripts/updateReplicationController.sh', 'Docker/Kubernetes/KubernetesEntitiesLibrary/package/Resources/scripts/updateService.sh', 'Docker/Kubernetes/README.rst', 'Docker/DockerInterfacesLibrary/package/Classes/DockerHostVolume.yaml', 'Docker/Kubernetes/KubernetesCluster/package/Resources/scripts/updatePod.sh', 'Docker/Kubernetes/KubernetesCluster/package/Resources/scripts/patchService.sh', 'Docker/Kubernetes/KubernetesEntitiesLibrary/package/Resources/scripts/updatePod.sh', 'Docker/Kubernetes/KubernetesPod/package/Classes/KubernetesPod.yaml', 'Docker/Kubernetes/KubernetesEntitiesLibrary/package/Resources/scripts/updateReplicationController.sh'], 'message': "Fixing volume entry definitions

 * According to
   http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/volumes/#types-of-volumes
   and
   https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/commit/a1b53250118bbfd462d7441833964d379e08802f
   there is hostPath volume type instead of hostDir;
   And there is no 'source' keyword anymore.

 * Replacing 'kubectl update' on 'kubectl replace':
   kubectl update is deprecated, need to use 'replace':
   https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/commit/9b3d42c090aeab663bf42e38658a5f88fb4b5272

Closes-Bug: #1604766

Change-Id: I1029caeb2827fc9de271b457c7a61b043d0189cb
"}]
commit_message:
Fixing volume entry definitions

 * According to
   http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/volumes/#types-of-volumes
   and
   https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/commit/a1b53250118bbfd462d7441833964d379e08802f
   there is hostPath volume type instead of hostDir;
   And there is no 'source' keyword anymore.

 * Replacing 'kubectl update' on 'kubectl replace':
   kubectl update is deprecated, need to use 'replace':
   https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/commit/9b3d42c090aeab663bf42e38658a5f88fb4b5272

Closes-Bug: #1604766

Change-Id: I1029caeb2827fc9de271b457c7a61b043d0189cb

This patch shall create VFs via the PCI SYS interface.
Default value : $::os_service_default
Sample Format : ['eth0:4','eth2:128']

for eth0 and eth2 will have the values 4 and 128 respectively

Change-Id: I2c1fce461d4602cd9f7de44b34e94920d1a581a6

Signed-off-by: karthik s <ksundara@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Configure the numvfs for SRIOV interfaces

This patch shall create VFs via the PCI SYS interface.
Default value : $::os_service_default
Sample Format : ['eth0:4','eth2:128']
For values as in sample format, the sriov_numvfs config files
for eth0 and eth2 will have the values 4 and 128 respectively

Change-Id: I2c1fce461d4602cd9f7de44b34e94920d1a581a6
Implements: blueprint tripleo-sriov
Signed-off-by: karthik s <ksundara@redhat.com>

subject: [Urgent] fix unit test failure casused by IPAM driver
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-24 03:22:15.000000000', 'files': ['tricircle/tests/unit/network/test_plugin.py'], 'message': '[Urgent] fix unit test failure casused by IPAM driver

1. What is the problem
After recent updates now Neutron uses pluggable IPAM driver backend by default,
while in the unit tests for network functionality in the Tricircle, unpluggable
IPAM driver backend is assumed to be used. So this default backend change causes
most of the unit tests fail.

2. What is the solution to the problem
In the setup of unit tests, set "ipam_driver" option as empty string to use
unpluggable IPAM driver backend.

3. What the features need to be implemented to the Tricircle
   to realize the solution
No new feature introduced.

Change-Id: Ifa85d4e209ac0fa04c21db316eee6ebc41981dab
'}]
commit_message:
[Urgent] fix unit test failure casused by IPAM driver

1. What is the problem
After recent updates now Neutron uses pluggable IPAM driver backend by default,
while in the unit tests for network functionality in the Tricircle, unpluggable
IPAM driver backend is assumed to be used. So this default backend change causes
most of the unit tests fail.

2. What is the solution to the problem
In the setup of unit tests, set "ipam_driver" option as empty string to use
unpluggable IPAM driver backend.

3. What the features need to be implemented to the Tricircle
   to realize the solution
No new feature introduced.

Change-Id: Ifa85d4e209ac0fa04c21db316eee6ebc41981dab

commit_message:
Add new project "os-failures"

os-failures is the library that provides a unified API
to do different failures in OpenStack cloud. The library
is designed to support multiple types of deployment
(devstack, fuel) and power management (ipmi, kvm).
Examples of usage: https://github.com/shakhat/os-failures

Change-Id: Ia0207dc7da57f303d081fceb5dcc093bd4e09485

subject: Fix 'Quick Installation Guide'
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-24 01:41:38.000000000', 'files': ['README.md'], 'message': "Fix 'Quick Installation Guide'

Installation stops at './s2aio.sh 1' with 'Quick Installation Guide'.
Because 's2aio.sh' needs argument of either 'jenkins' or 'dev' now.

This commit changes './s2aio.sh 1' to './s2aio.sh dev'.

Change-Id: I709e5d87c89b72e67f985407720fa9965ff978ee

commit_message:
Fix 'Quick Installation Guide'

Installation stops at './s2aio.sh 1' with 'Quick Installation Guide'.
Because 's2aio.sh' needs argument of either 'jenkins' or 'dev' now.

This commit changes './s2aio.sh 1' to './s2aio.sh dev'.

Change-Id: I709e5d87c89b72e67f985407720fa9965ff978ee
Closes-Bug: #1616267

commit_message:
Refactor shutdown_process and shutdown_all_process

This patch refactors two functions in daemon_factory, shutdown_process
and shutdown_all_processes, to make them as just utility functions to
manage storlet daemon.

[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-08-22 12:02:15.000000000', 'files': ['fuelmenu/modules/grubpw.py', 'fuelmenu/modules/__init__.py'], 'message': 'Add GrubPassword module to the fuelmenu

This change adds new GrubPassword module to the fuelmenu which can
configure password for the editing grub menu. The module creates the
default /boot/grub2/user.cfg file with hashed password only when it
entered interactively. For security reasons the plain password never
stored and the file always overwritten with new one provided.

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1552164
Change-Id: I3bc330133dd3d71ea62a7169a84d9ad802a4a3ef
Signed-off-by: Maksim Malchuk <mmalchuk@mirantis.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Add GrubPassword module to the fuelmenu

This change adds new GrubPassword module to the fuelmenu which can
configure password for the editing grub menu. The module creates the
default /boot/grub2/user.cfg file with hashed password only when it
entered interactively. For security reasons the plain password never
stored and the file always overwritten with new one provided.

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1552164
Change-Id: I3bc330133dd3d71ea62a7169a84d9ad802a4a3ef
Signed-off-by: Maksim Malchuk <mmalchuk@mirantis.com>

commit_message:
Removed directory changes in npm-dsvm-macro

These cause errors, and I'm not actually certain they're
necessary. See below for an example:

2016-08-23 20:54:06.076004 | + DEVSTACK_GATE_NEUTRON=1
2016-08-23 20:54:06.076015 | + export DISPLAY=:99
2016-08-23 20:54:06.076025 | + DISPLAY=:99
2016-08-23 20:54:06.076044 | + cd http://zm07.openstack.org/p/openstack/js-openstack-lib
2016-08-23 20:54:06.076084 | /tmp/c9142d636b2e4850ae5bf9b46036e9ae.sh: line 10: cd: http://zm07.openstack.org/p/openstack/js-openstack-lib: No such file or directory
2016-08-23 20:54:06.076439 | [Zuul] Task exit code: 1

http://logs.openstack.org/51/356751/7/check/js-openstack-lib-dsvm-nodejs6-npm-run-functional-test/095b291/console.html#_2016-08-23_20_54_06_076044

subject: Double rax-ord boot-timeout value
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-24 01:03:09.000000000', 'files': ['nodepool/nodepool.yaml'], 'message': 'Double rax-ord boot-timeout value

We are seeing a large amount of subnodes failing to boot in rax-ord,
lets double our boot-timeout to see if this solves some of the
problem.

Change-Id: I9f036228a927ba21b7f03b6137b6d7a7346b5aff
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Double rax-ord boot-timeout value

We are seeing a large amount of subnodes failing to boot in rax-ord,
lets double our boot-timeout to see if this solves some of the
problem.

Change-Id: I9f036228a927ba21b7f03b6137b6d7a7346b5aff
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

subject: tests: fix data_files testing
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-06-08 14:32:25.000000000', 'files': ['pbr/tests/test_packaging.py', 'pbr/tests/testpackage/setup.cfg'], 'message': 'tests: fix data_files testing

The current data-files entry is not used by any tests, and is actually not
working. The glob features only support * at the end of the path, and the
config key is 'data_files', not "data_files".

Fix this and add a test proving it works.

Change-Id: I9a9a9e138e7feb314187409e3087567f35264344
'}]
commit_message:
tests: fix data_files testing

The current data-files entry is not used by any tests, and is actually not
working. The glob features only support * at the end of the path, and the
config key is 'data_files', not "data_files".

Fix this and add a test proving it works.

Change-Id: I9a9a9e138e7feb314187409e3087567f35264344

[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-08-24 07:19:35.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt', 'README.rst', 'scripts/tripleo-ansible-inventory', 'setup.cfg'], 'message': 'Add a dynamic ansible inventory script

This commit adds an ansible dynamic inventory script that retrieve node
information from heat and other OpenStack services and allows to
connect to known nodes in the TripleO deployment.

The script is strongly inspired by the dynamic inventory of the now
retired tripleo-ansible project:

https://github.com/stackforge/tripleo-ansible/blob/bd0346b55b586d591e6ca46aa42fc3002fa3dd45/plugins/inventory/heat.py

Change-Id: I807fed12e9a42a71c130f393370ff4152831c27b
'}]
commit_message:
Add a dynamic ansible inventory script

This commit adds an ansible dynamic inventory script that retrieve node
information from heat and other OpenStack services and allows to
connect to known nodes in the TripleO deployment.

The script is strongly inspired by the dynamic inventory of the now
retired tripleo-ansible project:

https://github.com/stackforge/tripleo-ansible/blob/bd0346b55b586d591e6ca46aa42fc3002fa3dd45/plugins/inventory/heat.py

Change-Id: I807fed12e9a42a71c130f393370ff4152831c27b

subject: Correct reraising of exception
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-08-24 06:58:32.000000000', 'files': ['congress/datalog/factset.py', 'congress/datalog/nonrecursive.py', 'congress_dashboard/api/congress.py', 'congress_tempest_tests/tests/scenario/congress_ha/test_ha.py'], 'message': "Correct reraising of exception

When an exception was caught and rethrown, it should call 'raise' without any arguments
because it shows the place where an exception occured initially instead of place where
the exception re-raised

Change-Id: Ife2543bc31592d612f884dc354876e0ee30497e9
"}]
commit_message:
Correct reraising of exception

When an exception was caught and rethrown, it should call 'raise' without any arguments
because it shows the place where an exception occured initially instead of place where
the exception re-raised

Change-Id: Ife2543bc31592d612f884dc354876e0ee30497e9

commit_message:
Relocate alarm service into a submodule

This patch moves the resources of the alarm service (aodh) into a
submodule of the telemetry, as a service that can be addressed using
'alarm' as service type.

Change-Id: I0c2521443225e41b4090ee7ecb5f095072b1fc95

subject: Unify the type of value for what are True/False values
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-18 05:44:51.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/volume/test_volumes_get.py'], 'message': "Unify the type of value for what are True/False values

I'm going to unify the type of value for
what are True/False values.
https://bugs.launchpad.net/cinder/+bug/1589865

A above patch is related a bootable field
in cinder volume.
To merge a above patch, tempest(cinder gate test)
should consider a boolean type.

This patch is temporary patch to accommodate
boolean type and string type until fixed a above patch.

Closes-Bug: #1589865
Change-Id: Ic582949b67e2d35a86ad6559c791aa0e424d1a12
"}]
commit_message:
Unify the type of value for what are True/False values

I'm going to unify the type of value for
what are True/False values.
https://bugs.launchpad.net/cinder/+bug/1589865

A above patch is related a bootable field
in cinder volume.
To merge a above patch, tempest(cinder gate test)
should consider a boolean type.

This patch is temporary patch to accommodate
boolean type and string type until fixed a above patch.

Closes-Bug: #1589865
Change-Id: Ic582949b67e2d35a86ad6559c791aa0e424d1a12

subject: Move other-requirements.txt to bindep.txt
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-12 19:10:51.000000000', 'files': ['bindep.txt'], 'message': 'Move other-requirements.txt to bindep.txt

The default filename for documenting binary dependencies has been
changed from "other-requirements.txt" to "bindep.txt" with the release
of bindep 2.1.0. While the previous name is still supported, it will
be deprecated.

Move the file around to follow this change.

Note that this change is self-testing, the OpenStack CI infrastructure
will use a "bindep.txt" file to setup nodes for testing.

For more information about bindep, see also:
http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/drivers.html#package-requirements
http://docs.openstack.org/infra/bindep/

As well as this announcement:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-August/101590.html

Change-Id: Id9f2bc855dcd4b8a777eeaf634ac79786a3d01f3
'}]
commit_message:
Move other-requirements.txt to bindep.txt

The default filename for documenting binary dependencies has been
changed from "other-requirements.txt" to "bindep.txt" with the release
of bindep 2.1.0. While the previous name is still supported, it will
be deprecated.

Move the file around to follow this change.

Note that this change is self-testing, the OpenStack CI infrastructure
will use a "bindep.txt" file to setup nodes for testing.

For more information about bindep, see also:
http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/drivers.html#package-requirements
http://docs.openstack.org/infra/bindep/

As well as this announcement:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-August/101590.html

Change-Id: Id9f2bc855dcd4b8a777eeaf634ac79786a3d01f3

commit_message:
Include option to set SSLCertificateChainFile

Some cert providers require an chain cert file so this allows for this option.
In addition, I added tests for SSL that were missing for the apache vhost file.

Change-Id: Ib3c6cf82f6afb8a79952745d8fb2116a05f59c39

commit_message:
Move other-requirements.txt to bindep.txt

The default filename for documenting binary dependencies has been
changed from "other-requirements.txt" to "bindep.txt" with the release
of bindep 2.1.0. While the previous name is still supported, it will
be deprecated.

Move the file around to follow this change.

Note that this change is self-testing, the OpenStack CI infrastructure
will use a "bindep.txt" file to setup nodes for testing.

For more information about bindep, see also:
http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/drivers.html#package-requirements
http://docs.openstack.org/infra/bindep/

Change-Id: I6572c66491274ce263935f37aab50923e0ad869e

subject: Block pecan 1.0.2/1.0.3/1.0.4
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-23 22:16:45.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'message': "Block pecan 1.0.2/1.0.3/1.0.4

ironic-api doesn't work with specified pecan versions.
Distros rely on values from global-requirements when setting
dependency caps for packages. We need to block non-working versions
to keep openstack packages dependencies in sync.

Change-Id: I7f34d6bc2f098086c086c3ea0410672d6139d9d8
Closes-Bug: #1615645
(cherry picked from commit 95316c278d8c69e4275dd7e4284a1cefff2fecd1)
"}]
commit_message:
Block pecan 1.0.2/1.0.3/1.0.4

ironic-api doesn't work with specified pecan versions.
Distros rely on values from global-requirements when setting
dependency caps for packages. We need to block non-working versions
to keep openstack packages dependencies in sync.

Change-Id: I7f34d6bc2f098086c086c3ea0410672d6139d9d8
Closes-Bug: #1615645
(cherry picked from commit 95316c278d8c69e4275dd7e4284a1cefff2fecd1)

commit_message:
Set default/fix version numbers in upgrade script

This commit does the following:

1. Sets a default for I_REALLY_KNOW_WHAT_I_AM_DOING

Without this default, the script will error due to an unbound variable.
This happens as we have a 'set -u' specified in the script.

2. Updates version numbers from 12->13 to 13->14

Change-Id: I97c02d44722342b1867b4400921a66e6b2ea8a48
(cherry picked from commit d3aaab4745207507fb28e212394734da668b0747)

commit_message:
Filter the maxImageMeta out of limits API after 2.35

The image API was already deprecated after 2.35. But the ImageMetadata
API was forgotten to deprecate. This patch filter the maxImageMeta
field out of limits API after 2.35.

Change-Id: I34bd76971965a8b2f9f9e75fc16ef2c63b476008
Closes-Bug: #1614578

commit_message:
Refactor validate_resource_definitions()

We moved validate_resource_definitions() to template_common.py
for hot/cfn in Commit ed08e4f676d4512209937289e2068b62fb8591a0,
but then the Change I8fda1380504d1d8b1e96649bf20b86d6309fdeca
overwrote the method to validate the 'external_id', in fact
we could overwrite validate_resource_definition().

Change-Id: I1c6ce382d4d968602504f2e79f903c6d521cf288

subject: Load resources from DB for resource list
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4257, 'name': 'Zane Bitter', 'email': 'zbitter@redhat.com', 'username': 'zaneb'}, {'_account_id': 4571, 'name': 'Steve Baker', 'email': 'sbaker@redhat.com', 'username': 'steve-stevebaker'}, {'_account_id': 6899, 'name': 'Sirushti Murugesan', 'email': 'sirushtim@gmail.com', 'username': 'sirushtim'}, {'_account_id': 7385, 'name': 'Thomas Herve', 'email': 'therve@redhat.com', 'username': 'therve'}, {'_account_id': 8399, 'name': 'Jay Dobies', 'email': 'jason.dobies@redhat.com', 'username': 'jdob'}, {'_account_id': 8833, 'name': 'Rabi Mishra', 'email': 'ramishra@redhat.com', 'username': 'rabi'}, {'_account_id': 11424, 'name': 'Rakesh H S', 'email': 'rakeshhs1@gmail.com', 'username': 'rakesh'}, {'_account_id': 12259, 'name': 'Anant Patil', 'email': 'anant.techie@gmail.com', 'username': 'ananta'}, {'_account_id': 20066, 'name': 'Soumiyajit', 'email': 'soumiyajit@nectechnologies.in', 'username': 'Soumiyajit'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 19, 'created': '2016-08-14 20:36:21.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/test_stack.py', 'heat/engine/stack.py', 'heat/tests/engine/service/test_stack_resources.py', 'heat/engine/resource.py'], 'message': "Load resources from DB for resource list

Currently, when a user makes an API call to list resources, they were
retrieved from the currently active template associated with the
stack. This worked in the legacy engine where no concurrent updates
where possible. With convergence and thus concurrent updates, a stack
is allowed to have resources of previous traversals and still continue
creating new resources. Therefore, relying on the template to list
resources won't exactly match the state in the database.

For example, on deletes where we update with an empty template,
currently, the stack parses the empty template searching for
resources. Doing a `resource-list` when the stack is in a state of
DELETE_IN_PROGRESS shows an empty list of resources and therefore not
matching the state in the database.

This change makes iter_resources always call _find_filtered_resources
which builds all its resources from a database query.

Change-Id: Ibe87a773c38efb6d4865fd3a1dbd079972dd8be4
Closes-Bug: #1523748
Closes-Bug: #1301320
"}]
commit_message:
Load resources from DB for resource list

Currently, when a user makes an API call to list resources, they were
retrieved from the currently active template associated with the
stack. This worked in the legacy engine where no concurrent updates
where possible. With convergence and thus concurrent updates, a stack
is allowed to have resources of previous traversals and still continue
creating new resources. Therefore, relying on the template to list
resources won't exactly match the state in the database.

For example, on deletes where we update with an empty template,
currently, the stack parses the empty template searching for
resources. Doing a `resource-list` when the stack is in a state of
DELETE_IN_PROGRESS shows an empty list of resources and therefore not
matching the state in the database.

This change makes iter_resources always call _find_filtered_resources
which builds all its resources from a database query.

Change-Id: Ibe87a773c38efb6d4865fd3a1dbd079972dd8be4
Closes-Bug: #1523748
Closes-Bug: #1301320

commit_message:
Deprecated the image-metadata API after 2.35

The image API was deprecated after 2.35 already. But the sub-resource
image-metadata of image was forgotten to deprecate. This patch deprecate
the image-metdata API after 2.35.

Change-Id: I8d933c2124ec2021f9fa0b706a7a2de223e36e80
Partial-Bug: #1614578

commit_message:
Handle invalid input sent to monasca-forwarder

When an invalid json input is sent to monasca-forwarder API,
the exception is not caught and handled properly. This patch fixes
the existing try;except logic to encapsulate the json decoding operation
so that the exception is caught.

Closes-Bug: #1613827
Change-Id: Icc717c3b8cf2c5880f2ba7823746b31780b1a2de

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-06 22:50:40.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_api.py', 'nova/compute/api.py'], 'message': "Use stashed volume connector in _local_cleanup_bdm_volumes

When we perform a local delete in the compute API during the volumes
cleanup, Nova calls the volume_api.terminate_connection passing a fake
volume connector. That call is useless and it has no real effect on the
volume server side.

With a686185fc02ec421fd27270a343c19f668b95da6 in mitaka we started
stashing the connector in the bdm.connection_info so this change
tries to use that if it's available, which it won't be for attachments
made before that change -or- for volumes attached to an instance in
shelved_offloaded state that were never unshelved (because the actual
volume attach for those instances happens on the compute manager after
you unshelve the instance).

If we can't find a stashed connector, or we find one whose host does
not match the instance.host, we punt and just don't call
terminate_connection at all since calling it with a fake connector
can actually make some cinder volume backends fail and then the
volume is orphaned.

Closes-Bug: #1609984

Co-Authored-By: Matt Riedemann <mriedem@us.ibm.com>

Change-Id: I9f9ead51238e27fa45084c8e3d3edee76a8b0218
(cherry picked from commit 33510d4be990417d2a3a428106f6f745db5af6ed)
"}]
commit_message:
Use stashed volume connector in _local_cleanup_bdm_volumes

When we perform a local delete in the compute API during the volumes
cleanup, Nova calls the volume_api.terminate_connection passing a fake
volume connector. That call is useless and it has no real effect on the
volume server side.

With a686185fc02ec421fd27270a343c19f668b95da6 in mitaka we started
stashing the connector in the bdm.connection_info so this change
tries to use that if it's available, which it won't be for attachments
made before that change -or- for volumes attached to an instance in
shelved_offloaded state that were never unshelved (because the actual
volume attach for those instances happens on the compute manager after
you unshelve the instance).

If we can't find a stashed connector, or we find one whose host does
not match the instance.host, we punt and just don't call
terminate_connection at all since calling it with a fake connector
can actually make some cinder volume backends fail and then the
volume is orphaned.

Closes-Bug: #1609984

Co-Authored-By: Matt Riedemann <mriedem@us.ibm.com>

Change-Id: I9f9ead51238e27fa45084c8e3d3edee76a8b0218
(cherry picked from commit 33510d4be990417d2a3a428106f6f745db5af6ed)

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-01 14:02:31.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/list-server-bad-status-fix-7db504b38c8d732f.yaml', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/extended_server_attributes.py', 'nova/tests/unit/api/openstack/compute/test_extended_server_attributes.py'], 'message': 'Return HTTP 200 on list for invalid status

The server listing API raises a 500 error if you pass an invalid status
filter for admin user. In the case of a non-admin user, it simply
returns an empty list. In the case of an admin user, it fetches extended
server attributes, so a condition was added to get extended server
attributes only when servers list is not empty.

This change simply removes the cause of the 500 exception. A subsequent
patch with a microversion bump will modify the behavior so that a 400
Bad Request will be raised for an invalid status, for both admin and
non-admin alike.

Co-Authored-By: Dinesh Bhor <dinesh.bhor@nttdata.com>

Closes-Bug: #1579706

Change-Id: I10bde78f0a9ac59b8646d58f62fa5056f989f54f
(cherry picked from commit ee4d69e28dfb3d4764186d0c0212d53c99bda3ca)
'}]
commit_message:
Return HTTP 200 on list for invalid status

The server listing API raises a 500 error if you pass an invalid status
filter for admin user. In the case of a non-admin user, it simply
returns an empty list. In the case of an admin user, it fetches extended
server attributes, so a condition was added to get extended server
attributes only when servers list is not empty.

This change simply removes the cause of the 500 exception. A subsequent
patch with a microversion bump will modify the behavior so that a 400
Bad Request will be raised for an invalid status, for both admin and
non-admin alike.

Co-Authored-By: Dinesh Bhor <dinesh.bhor@nttdata.com>

Closes-Bug: #1579706

Change-Id: I10bde78f0a9ac59b8646d58f62fa5056f989f54f
(cherry picked from commit ee4d69e28dfb3d4764186d0c0212d53c99bda3ca)

commit_message:
don't report network limits after 2.35

We correctly stopped reporting the limits for things like security
groups and floating ips after mv 2.35. We completely missed that
limits are modified by the used_limits extension, and hilarity
ensued. We were reporting no maxSecurityGroups over the wire, but we
were reporting totalSecurityGroups through the magic of extensions.

Change-Id: I85b2b41d919ed6987d4c9288905ccce49c10c81f
Closes-Bug: #1614133

1. What is the problem
The current Nova_APIGW does not support microversion function, the service
controller uses a fixed API version number to initialize novaclient

2. What is the solution to the problem
When the service controller receives an API request, it will get the
microversion number from request headers , and use this to initialize
novaclient.

For how to get the microversion number, please refer to:
https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/kilo/implemented/api-microversions.html

The microversion supported range is 2.36 to latest version

3. What the features need to be implemented to the Tricircle
   to realize the solution
Nova_APIGW microversion support added

Change-Id: I64c757508fb0a244fa88fa56a6d9d4aa27a9739a
'}]
commit_message:
Nova_APIGW REST API Microversion Support

1. What is the problem
The current Nova_APIGW does not support microversion function, the service
controller uses a fixed API version number to initialize novaclient

2. What is the solution to the problem
When the service controller receives an API request, it will get the
microversion number from request headers , and use this to initialize
novaclient.

For how to get the microversion number, please refer to:
https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/kilo/implemented/api-microversions.html

The microversion supported range is 2.36 to latest version

3. What the features need to be implemented to the Tricircle
   to realize the solution
Nova_APIGW microversion support added

Change-Id: I64c757508fb0a244fa88fa56a6d9d4aa27a9739a

subject: Enable DeprecationWarning in test environments
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-08-18 20:36:41.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Enable DeprecationWarning in test environments

Many deprecations are triggered early (on imports, for example)
before the warnings are enabled by the WarningsFixture in the
base test class.

To make sure all DeprecationWarning messages are emitted we enable
them via the PYTHONWARNINGS environment variable.

Change-Id: I64485da329b9ac8915675885783ffd5b2bf81ea6
'}]
commit_message:
Enable DeprecationWarning in test environments

Many deprecations are triggered early (on imports, for example)
before the warnings are enabled by the WarningsFixture in the
base test class.

To make sure all DeprecationWarning messages are emitted we enable
them via the PYTHONWARNINGS environment variable.

Change-Id: I64485da329b9ac8915675885783ffd5b2bf81ea6

commit_message:

being renamed to ``project_id``.

This neutron_taas change accompanies the neutron change:

Change-Id: Ia7c462c42ecf7cbe411254aa6a046a2c9ddc64b5

commit_message:
Consistent fixed network name

Fixed network name for kubernetes driver has been given
"private". For mesos and swarm driver, fixed network name's are
generated.

if consistency has to be maintained then fixed network name's for
mesos and swarm driver has to be "private" because kubernetes driver
does not support any other names.

Change-Id: Ia7c462c42ecf7cbe411254aa6a046a2c9ddc64b5
Closes-bug: #1523402

commit_message:
Fix reported driver's versions

This is part of the effort to gather accurate information
about Cinder drivers. Some drivers are not reporting the
driver version in the driver class, and therefore, the
'./generate_driver_list.py' script is getting the information
('N/A') from the base class.

Change-Id: I3beae8fdd7e65d3688b930943ef74abe4b29d799

subject: Fix Tempest tests
revisions:
[{'number': 13, 'created': '2016-07-25 13:16:38.000000000', 'files': ['monasca_tempest_tests/tests/api/test_alarm_state_history_multiple_transitions.py', 'monasca_tempest_tests/tests/api/test_statistics.py', 'monasca_tempest_tests/tests/api/base.py'], 'message': 'Fix Tempest tests

Fix monasca_tempest_tests.tests.api.test_statistics.TestStatistics.
test_list_statistics_with_offset_limit by assuming offset is an
opaque value and making sure it is urldecoded and urlencoded as
it should be. Also, previously, the test was trying to use an offset
returned by measurement-list and apply it to metric-statistics.
That is not required to work by the API definition and should not
be attempted

Fix the Alarm State tests by using the offset returned from the
API and not trying to build one. Also, ensure offset is urldecoded
and urlencoded as should be

Change-Id: Ib4ad5b7f0450dd9415496276b38bd12f2921e5d7
'}]
commit_message:
Fix Tempest tests

Fix monasca_tempest_tests.tests.api.test_statistics.TestStatistics.
test_list_statistics_with_offset_limit by assuming offset is an
opaque value and making sure it is urldecoded and urlencoded as
it should be. Also, previously, the test was trying to use an offset
returned by measurement-list and apply it to metric-statistics.
That is not required to work by the API definition and should not
be attempted

Fix the Alarm State tests by using the offset returned from the
API and not trying to build one. Also, ensure offset is urldecoded
and urlencoded as should be

Change-Id: Ib4ad5b7f0450dd9415496276b38bd12f2921e5d7

commit_message:
Update api-ref for v1.22

This commit does several things, which were just easier to do together.

- Adds a new "misc" page describing the /v1/lookup and /v1/heartbeat
  resources.
- Adds descriptions of the node.resource_class and
  node.network_interface fields that were introduced into the API but
  not into the documentation.
- Introduces a new script, api-ref/regenerate-samples.sh, which can be
  used with Ironic to automate the generation of most of the sample files
  used in the api-ref documententation.
- Corrects several errors in the sample JSON files that rendered errors
  when using them with curl for POST, PUT, or PATCH.
- Uses the aforementioned regenerate-samples.sh script to regenerate
  most of the JSON result samples, ensuring that they are all up to date
  with the v1.22 API microversion.
- Removes a few old/incorrect "Error Code" listings.
- Updates the index page to remove extraneous wording.

Change-Id: I764cbb43be15f05ba681de6ce1be1ae7c022173d

commit_message:
Remove tenant_safe flag from rpc and db api

We can use admin_context to have access to stacks
and software configs across projects. This removes
the tenant_safe flag from rpc and db api. This is
backward compatible with older rpc clients.

We still support use of global_tenant flag for listing
stacks and software configs. However, by default
an admin(user with admin role in admin_project)
would not need that.

Change-Id: I12303dbf30fb80290f95baba0c67cdf684f5f409

commit_message:
Enable ra on gateway when add gateway to HA router

Now the 'accept_ra' will only be configured when HA router change
state to 'master'. If the router gateway is added after router state
change, the gateway port in 'master' HA router will not be configured.

This patch will configure 'accept_ra' for the 'master' HA router.

Change-Id: Ice1f3e6e48597ea8c366e243c2ca1771ea9b7770
Closes-bug: #1585246

When Tempest list Trove flavors, the returned flavor contains name, ram
and vcpus.

An example of test run without this patch:

commit_message:
tempest/test_flavors: vcpus is in db

When Tempest list Trove flavors, the returned flavor contains name, ram
and vcpus.

An example of test run without this patch:

testtools.matchers._impl.MismatchError: {u'name': u'm1.nano', u'ram':
128, u'id': 42, u'links': [{u'href':
u'https://[::1]:8779/v1.0/04f8954d605644088e9f87cc3383dfef/flavors/42',
u'rel': u'self'}, {u'href': u'https://[::1]:8779/flavors/42', u'rel':
u'bookmark'}], u'str_id': u'42', u'vcpus': 1} matches Contains('vcpus')

We can see 'vcpus' is part of the flavor properties and need to be
checked in the validation.

Change-Id: I9bb18dc539e98bfe1e0d0b4dd1fe6263f95b6499
Closes-Bug: #1612398

commit_message:
Pin puppetlabs_spec_helper to 1.1.1

With the release of puppetlabs_spec_helper 1.2.0, it started pulling in
a gem that requires ruby >= 2.2.0. Since CI currently runs on ruby 2.1,
we need to pin to an older release of puppetlabs_spec_helper.

Depends-On: Iec7ce821de1f03dc8730ebc689b441f6e053f143
Change-Id: Ib86204b91f62e96c4bf21cd668324f847718fe2a
Closes-Bug: #1616190

commit_message:
Improve code readability

Fox example: assertTrue(a in resp.headers and
                        b in resp.headers and
                        c not in resp.headers) is equal to:
             assertIn(a, resp.headers)
             assertIn(b, resp.headers)
             assertNotIn(c, resp.headers)

Change-Id: I8044d4a5c30fd9198b04466eb4c280e56995b28b

Jugde container-name length

that can reduce loads from wrong requests.

commit_message:
Support purge of soft-deleted resources from DB tables

This commit adds support to purge soft-deleted resources and their
corresponding event entries from DB tables via tacker-db-manage

Implements: blueprint: audit-support

Co-Authored-By: Kanagaraj Manickam <mkr1481@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: gong yong sheng <gong.yongsheng@99cloud.net>
Co-Authored-By: Vishwanath Jayaraman <vishwanathj@hotmail.com>

Change-Id: Ice3cca08c00941fa069e66de5d09fede2ab67322

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-27 09:45:22.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/vmwareapi/vmops.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/vmwareapi/test_vmops.py'], 'message': 'VMware: enable a resize of instance with no root disk

This addresses the issue when the user wishes to update the CPU
or memory of the instance.

No changes to disks will be done if there is no root disk.

Examples of when there is no root disk:
1. When an instance is booted from a cinder volume.
2. When booting from an ISO and the root disk size is zero

In these cases there will not be a disk created on the vmware
shared datastore.

Change-Id: I848fd3e57ec2f9cbc4fc31fd9ec3fe515fee4f32
Closes-bug: #1444446
(cherry picked from commit 54afe44c7b68902556850baf4eba0846b000aa35)
'}]
commit_message:
VMware: enable a resize of instance with no root disk

This addresses the issue when the user wishes to update the CPU
or memory of the instance.

No changes to disks will be done if there is no root disk.

Examples of when there is no root disk:
1. When an instance is booted from a cinder volume.
2. When booting from an ISO and the root disk size is zero

In these cases there will not be a disk created on the vmware
shared datastore.

Change-Id: I848fd3e57ec2f9cbc4fc31fd9ec3fe515fee4f32
Closes-bug: #1444446
(cherry picked from commit 54afe44c7b68902556850baf4eba0846b000aa35)

commit_message:
Update instance host in post live migration even when exception occurs

Currently when, e.g., port binding fails on destination host nova
loses track of running VM. Operator needs to change record in DB
manually in order to recover VM in nova and then perform operations
on destination host to repair such VM. Because VM is on destination
host already it should be updated regardless of post live migration
at destination result.


(cherry picked from commit 89b1fecce116bc44f558e76cbb5dc43497ea67cc)

Change-Id: Ibb5158f453abd9717e6d2ab501295351ca9d0dcf
Closes-Bug: #1379581
Conflicts:
	nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_mgr.py

subject: Add mariadb client binaries to kolla-toolbox
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-23 21:41:56.000000000', 'files': ['docker/kolla-toolbox/Dockerfile.j2'], 'message': "Add mariadb client binaries to kolla-toolbox

The kolla-toolbox container contains ansible which has the mysql_db
module which helps on various mysql tasks such as db creation. The
mysql_db module requires certain mysql binaries in order to accomplish
tasks such as restoring a database from a dump.

This change adds those client libraries which weren't previously
included in the container.

Change-Id: I6516838381bf9327c8901fc4c32ebd5151fb053f
Signed-off-by: Stephan Michaud <michauds90@gmail.com>
Closes-Bug: #1616155
"}]
commit_message:
Add mariadb client binaries to kolla-toolbox

The kolla-toolbox container contains ansible which has the mysql_db
module which helps on various mysql tasks such as db creation. The
mysql_db module requires certain mysql binaries in order to accomplish
tasks such as restoring a database from a dump.

This change adds those client libraries which weren't previously
included in the container.

Change-Id: I6516838381bf9327c8901fc4c32ebd5151fb053f
Signed-off-by: Stephan Michaud <michauds90@gmail.com>
Closes-Bug: #1616155

commit_message:
Revert "FWaaS v2 Database"

This reverts commit 39e4dd9a1539a2387beb0e1e8940a4e515608dc9.

As the commit had multiple db migration problems,
it's better to revert it for now and try again after
enabling tests. [1]

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/357028/

Change-Id: I69533e568bfd9ceed0715d400b8ca3f87553758b
Closes-Bug: #1615572
Closes-Bug: #1615577
Closes-Bug: #1615578

commit_message:
Update the 'list' method of volumeprovider about Cinder

'fuxi' in search_opts should be extracted from CONF:
Otherwise, CONF.volume_from changed, cmd docker volume ls could not obtain the
expected result

Change-Id: I2d021d26a5c73f4d231ddc638dc204041ddce29b
Closes-Bug: #1609763

commit_message:
run_tests: disable TestEncryptedCinderVolumes tests

Something broke in Cinder and we'll need those 2 patches to run
TestEncryptedCinderVolumes again:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/358670/
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/359391/

Until they are merged, let's ignore the tests.

Change-Id: Ibbe9544cb2991d16499993975694ec4fe6859f0b

commit_message:
Remove admin-state-down from lbaas-member-update

lbaas-member-update used --admin-state-down, which was deprecated
in Mitaka. It has been removed in this version using this patch.

commit_message:
Add comment about how status field changed

There are some review comments on the status , vm_state
changes confusion in patch https://review.openstack.org/#/c/258472
for this bug, so this patch added some comments to make
reviewer easier to read the code logic.

Change-Id: I65e77feeddcf477bd5550baaa440b4a1a325bb91
Related-Bug: 1526715

subject: Update oslo.context requirement to 2.9.0
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-08-20 23:34:55.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'message': "Update oslo.context requirement to 2.9.0

In the 2.9.0 release of oslo.context there are changes to the base
from_dict method that will help to cleanup the from_dict in all the
service's from_dict overrides and help with policy.

Change-Id: I00d0db3738b0099fabe263b3765533d9655385f9
"}]
commit_message:
Update oslo.context requirement to 2.9.0

In the 2.9.0 release of oslo.context there are changes to the base
from_dict method that will help to cleanup the from_dict in all the
service's from_dict overrides and help with policy.

Change-Id: I00d0db3738b0099fabe263b3765533d9655385f9

commit_message:
Cloud admin script auto-config hostconfig defaults

- Support for auto-generation of hostconfig JSON for use with
  pseudo port binding controller for networking-odl
- Command line options added for customization of hostconfigs
- Auto dectect OVS data path type for appropriate hostconfig JSON generation

Change-Id: Ie0173abe461b5c4a0de3524c98dfa83b405eb829

subject: Change assertTrue(isinstance()) by optimal assert
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-08-19 01:52:00.000000000', 'files': ['tests_to_fix/test_elastic.py', 'tests_to_fix/test_java_jmx.py', 'tests_to_fix/test_haproxy.py', 'tests_to_fix/test_solr.py', 'tests_to_fix/test_gearman.py', 'tests_to_fix/test_cassandra_jmx.py', 'tests_to_fix/test_mongo.py', 'tests_to_fix/test_tomcat.py'], 'message': 'Change assertTrue(isinstance()) by optimal assert

Some of tests use different method of assertTrue(isinstance(A, B))
or assertEqual(type(A), B).
The correct way is to use assertIsInstance(A, B) provided by testtools.

Change-Id: Ie83d8c3b62a6140ca71bb5889cffd3eb138c8658
'}]
commit_message:
Change assertTrue(isinstance()) by optimal assert

Some of tests use different method of assertTrue(isinstance(A, B))
or assertEqual(type(A), B).
The correct way is to use assertIsInstance(A, B) provided by testtools.

Change-Id: Ie83d8c3b62a6140ca71bb5889cffd3eb138c8658

commit_message:
Use upper constraints for all jobs in tox.ini

all jobs. Updated tox.ini to use upper constraints
for all jobs.

subject: Install python-openstackclient before plugins
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-23 23:34:26.000000000', 'files': ['stack.sh'], 'message': "Install python-openstackclient before plugins

Everything except for OSC installs before plugins, then plugins run.
That's great, because if a devstack plugin needs to do something
explicit with the software installed, it can. But then OSC gets
installed and can step on the install that was done by the plugin.

Just move it to before the plugin, so that plugins can have the final
say on versions of things installed.

Change-Id: I2c5658945fda5a66aa26fc4ac111f109ba79c5a6
"}]
commit_message:
Install python-openstackclient before plugins

Everything except for OSC installs before plugins, then plugins run.
That's great, because if a devstack plugin needs to do something
explicit with the software installed, it can. But then OSC gets
installed and can step on the install that was done by the plugin.

Just move it to before the plugin, so that plugins can have the final
say on versions of things installed.

Change-Id: I2c5658945fda5a66aa26fc4ac111f109ba79c5a6

commit_message:
Add Plan Deletion

This patch adds a mistral action that deletes a plan by deleting
the swift container and mistral environment matching a given container
name. It will not delete the plan if a stack exists with the same name.

Change-Id: I601aa2072271e072201be0c7d7237e0108494fb5
Partial-Bug: 1613196

subject: Fix unbracket_ipv6()
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-23 12:42:11.000000000', 'files': ['tripleoclient/utils.py'], 'message': 'Fix unbracket_ipv6()

Due to a bug, the logical condition as previously written only took
into account the second part. This patch amends the condition so that
both parts of the condition are properly evaluated.

Change-Id: I3c72787c912e1b37dab24f26666cc4f12ef53317
(cherry picked from commit 2a9a168a4e58a208817aaf2b9be3a2ca5b3d00d5)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix unbracket_ipv6()

Due to a bug, the logical condition as previously written only took
into account the second part. This patch amends the condition so that
both parts of the condition are properly evaluated.

Change-Id: I3c72787c912e1b37dab24f26666cc4f12ef53317
(cherry picked from commit 2a9a168a4e58a208817aaf2b9be3a2ca5b3d00d5)

commit_message:
[sshutils] Catch socket.error in put_file

`_put_file_sftp` can raise different types of errors. paramiko.SSHException,

subject: Add 'More Actions' constant text
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-08-19 15:15:17.000000000', 'files': ['searchlight_ui/static/resources/resources.module.js'], 'message': "Add 'More Actions' constant text

We're adding 'More Actions' as a constant for two reasons: a) because
it will be reused among many registrations and should be configurable,
and b) because we want to ensure it gets translated before the end of the
release.

Change-Id: I709e99e0c5b855718ef94e173fddc4b48e67f904
"}]
commit_message:
Add 'More Actions' constant text

We're adding 'More Actions' as a constant for two reasons: a) because
it will be reused among many registrations and should be configurable,
and b) because we want to ensure it gets translated before the end of the
release.

Change-Id: I709e99e0c5b855718ef94e173fddc4b48e67f904

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-17 11:11:06.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/plugins/ml2/plugin.py'], 'message': 'Add DB retry logic in ML2 delete_port()

I9aa792dc5711724ec40d7142570562a816112712 applied the db retry logic
to update_port_status(), but seems like in some cases, it is also
needed on delete_port()

Bug 1613251 describes an issue where the deletion if a loadbalancer
vip_port fail with StaleDataError.
This happens when the you delete a loadbalancer and then try
to delete its vip port, which in the mean time gets updated as well,
thus, raise the StaleDataError.

Change-Id: Icbe040c4bc813f32419c8359d3bec9945b09269a
Closes-Bug: #1613251
'}]
commit_message:
Add DB retry logic in ML2 delete_port()

I9aa792dc5711724ec40d7142570562a816112712 applied the db retry logic
to update_port_status(), but seems like in some cases, it is also
needed on delete_port()

Bug 1613251 describes an issue where the deletion if a loadbalancer
vip_port fail with StaleDataError.
This happens when the you delete a loadbalancer and then try
to delete its vip port, which in the mean time gets updated as well,
thus, raise the StaleDataError.

Change-Id: Icbe040c4bc813f32419c8359d3bec9945b09269a
Closes-Bug: #1613251

subject: Block pecan 1.0.2/1.0.3/1.0.4
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-08-22 16:41:59.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'message': "Block pecan 1.0.2/1.0.3/1.0.4

ironic-api doesn't work with specified pecan versions.
Distros rely on values from global-requirements when setting
dependency caps for packages. We need to block non-working versions
to keep openstack packages dependencies in sync.

Change-Id: I7f34d6bc2f098086c086c3ea0410672d6139d9d8
Closes-Bug: #1615645
"}]
commit_message:
Block pecan 1.0.2/1.0.3/1.0.4

ironic-api doesn't work with specified pecan versions.
Distros rely on values from global-requirements when setting
dependency caps for packages. We need to block non-working versions
to keep openstack packages dependencies in sync.

Change-Id: I7f34d6bc2f098086c086c3ea0410672d6139d9d8
Closes-Bug: #1615645

Fix db vs migration mismatches

<firewall_policy_rule_associations_v2>, primary_key=True, nullable=False))),

        UniqueConstraint(Column('firewall_rule_id', VARCHAR(length=36), ForeignK
ey(u'firewall_rules_v2.id'), ForeignKey(u'firewall_rules_v2.id'), table=<firewal
l_policy_rule_associations_v2>, primary_key=True, nullable=False)))]

commit_message:
Use constraints for all tox environments

Infra is now ready to use constraints everywhere [1], so adapt
releasenotes, coverage, and venv to use the default install command
instead of a specific non-constrained install command.

With this change, all tox environments now use constraints.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-August/101474.html

Change-Id: I879f34129c0d958be0a73bfdc7f641e178d4efe9

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-12 18:54:36.000000000', 'files': ['bindep.txt'], 'message': 'Move other-requirements.txt to bindep.txt

The default filename for documenting binary dependencies has been
changed from "other-requirements.txt" to "bindep.txt" with the release
of bindep 2.1.0. While the previous name is still supported, it will
be deprecated.

Move the file around to follow this change.

Note that this change is self-testing, the OpenStack CI infrastructure
will use a "bindep.txt" file to setup nodes for testing.

For more information about bindep, see also:
http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/drivers.html#package-requirements
http://docs.openstack.org/infra/bindep/

As well as this announcement:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-August/101590.html

Change-Id: Ie1e1afa1db2690c7960697dfbd8acaeab5d6c79e
'}]
commit_message:
Move other-requirements.txt to bindep.txt

The default filename for documenting binary dependencies has been
changed from "other-requirements.txt" to "bindep.txt" with the release
of bindep 2.1.0. While the previous name is still supported, it will
be deprecated.

Move the file around to follow this change.

Note that this change is self-testing, the OpenStack CI infrastructure
will use a "bindep.txt" file to setup nodes for testing.

For more information about bindep, see also:
http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/drivers.html#package-requirements
http://docs.openstack.org/infra/bindep/

As well as this announcement:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-August/101590.html

Change-Id: Ie1e1afa1db2690c7960697dfbd8acaeab5d6c79e

subject: Add group types and group specs
revisions:
[{'number': 13, 'created': '2016-08-19 19:23:42.000000000', 'files': ['cinderclient/v3/client.py', 'cinderclient/v3/shell.py', 'cinderclient/v3/group_types.py', 'cinderclient/api_versions.py', 'cinderclient/tests/unit/v3/test_group_types.py', 'cinderclient/tests/unit/v3/test_shell.py', 'cinderclient/tests/unit/v3/fakes.py'], 'message': 'Add group types and group specs

This patch adds support for group types and group specs
in the client.

Server patch is merged: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/320165/

Current microversion is 3.11. The following CLI's are supported.
cinder --os-volume-api-version 3.11 group-type-create my_test_group
cinder --os-volume-api-version 3.11 group-type-list
cinder --os-volume-api-version 3.11 group-type-show my_test_group
cinder --os-volume-api-version 3.11 group-type-key my_test_group
    set test_key=test_val
cinder --os-volume-api-version 3.11 group-specs-list
cinder --os-volume-api-version 3.11 group-type-key my_test_group
    unset test_key
cinder --os-volume-api-version 3.11 group-type-update <group type uuid>
    --name "new_group" --description "my group type"
cinder --os-volume-api-version 3.11 group-type-delete new_group

Change-Id: I161a96aa53208e78146cb115d500fd6b2c42d046
Partial-Implements: blueprint generic-volume-group
'}]
commit_message:
Add group types and group specs

This patch adds support for group types and group specs
in the client.

Server patch is merged: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/320165/

Current microversion is 3.11. The following CLI's are supported.
cinder --os-volume-api-version 3.11 group-type-create my_test_group
cinder --os-volume-api-version 3.11 group-type-list
cinder --os-volume-api-version 3.11 group-type-show my_test_group
cinder --os-volume-api-version 3.11 group-type-key my_test_group
    set test_key=test_val
cinder --os-volume-api-version 3.11 group-specs-list
cinder --os-volume-api-version 3.11 group-type-key my_test_group
    unset test_key
cinder --os-volume-api-version 3.11 group-type-update <group type uuid>
    --name "new_group" --description "my group type"
cinder --os-volume-api-version 3.11 group-type-delete new_group

Change-Id: I161a96aa53208e78146cb115d500fd6b2c42d046
Partial-Implements: blueprint generic-volume-group

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-08-16 17:33:29.000000000', 'files': ['specs/ocata/ha-aa-job-distribution.rst', 'specs/newton/ha-aa-job-distribution.rst'], 'message': "Update Job Distribution for A/A Specs

During Austin Summit it was decided that we should change approved specs
approach to Job Distribution for Active-Active configurations.

This patch updates the specs to use the concept of cluster instead of
using the host and adding the concept of nodes as agreed during the
design session.

It also moves the spec to Ocata to make sure there's no confusion on
whether this is implemented or not.

Change-Id: I5f8194a52ff249d85fdf4ac9cfb184a9f33e1ccc
Implements: blueprint cinder-volume-active-active-support
"}]
commit_message:
Update Job Distribution for A/A Specs

During Austin Summit it was decided that we should change approved specs
approach to Job Distribution for Active-Active configurations.

This patch updates the specs to use the concept of cluster instead of
using the host and adding the concept of nodes as agreed during the
design session.

It also moves the spec to Ocata to make sure there's no confusion on
whether this is implemented or not.

Change-Id: I5f8194a52ff249d85fdf4ac9cfb184a9f33e1ccc
Implements: blueprint cinder-volume-active-active-support

commit_message:
Add support for fetching console logs from servers

Added get_server_console method to fetch the console
log from a Server. On clouds that do not expose this
feature, a debug line will be logged and an empty
string will be returned.

Change-Id: Ifb973c7d382118d3a8b6bf406cb7ed463b057180

It was a good attempt to update Tempest plugin, but Tempest folks reverted a patch in Tempest:

commit_message:
Revert "Fix config group for SSL in tempest test"

It was a good attempt to update Tempest plugin, but Tempest folks reverted a patch in Tempest:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/357907/

So now Aodh's gate is broken because the parameters are not in the right section. Let's revert it until things are cleaned up in Tempest and Oslo.config.

This reverts commit 3d3ad69e367456520666d8ca32e67a5ed03d24a4.

Change-Id: I5e724d870e029b9b72484b14c89f9d65de4615e9

commit_message:
fix checklist summary

If the file is includes twice with toctree,
Sphinx ovrewrites the documentation structure,
which breaks page navigation. Therefore, we should
not use toctree to include the same file twice.

Change-Id: I46d9a8f13fbe66dd3b0ccee33b083a4a2de91aa3
Closes-Bug: #1605017

subject: Add  docstrings for hacking.checks
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-22 22:08:40.000000000', 'files': ['neutron_lib/hacking/checks.py'], 'message': "Add  docstrings for hacking.checks

Cleaning up a little technical debt by adding docstrings
for our public APIs.

For hacking checks we use the pep8 docstring format [1] so
that the pep8 check codes can be auto-detected by pep8.
I've manually tested neutron-lib master + this change with
neutron master to ensure pep8 for neutron has no impacts.

Note: I plan to submit a patch per file as part of this bug work.
These patches won't depend on each other. The last patch of
the series will close the bug.

[1] https://github.com/PyCQA/pycodestyle/blob/1.5.7/pep8.py#L100

Change-Id: I0b7c068ee33c0199ea550c1ecdb4dd34fc40140a
Partial-Bug: #1614594
"}]
commit_message:
Add  docstrings for hacking.checks

Cleaning up a little technical debt by adding docstrings
for our public APIs.

For hacking checks we use the pep8 docstring format [1] so
that the pep8 check codes can be auto-detected by pep8.
I've manually tested neutron-lib master + this change with
neutron master to ensure pep8 for neutron has no impacts.

Note: I plan to submit a patch per file as part of this bug work.
These patches won't depend on each other. The last patch of
the series will close the bug.

[1] https://github.com/PyCQA/pycodestyle/blob/1.5.7/pep8.py#L100

Change-Id: I0b7c068ee33c0199ea550c1ecdb4dd34fc40140a
Partial-Bug: #1614594

commit_message:
Migrate stacks from legacy to convergence engine

Run `heat-manage migrate-convergence-1 <stack_id>` to migrate
legacy stack to convergence engine.

Heat engine is used for doing migration i.e. migration can't
be done offline.

Change-Id: Ie7c2498b37937438f16d154b154b3a6ecbf9ff74
Implements-bp: convergence-migrate-stack

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-08-23 14:03:10.000000000', 'files': ['cluster_upgrade/objects/adapters.py', 'cluster_upgrade/validators.py', 'cluster_upgrade/tests/test_validators.py'], 'message': "Disallow to change operating system during upgrade

commit_message:
Disallow to change operating system during upgrade

Changing of an operating system for clouds nodes is not supported and is
not tested at all. That's why this additional validation was added.

Change-Id: Ibf6db17f783879eff88e2366dfdb0a2871e2aa0a

Deployers are seeing issues when enabling caching where for some
reason unexpected values are being returned. This may be because
there is a collision in the mangled key when there are lots of
values stored in the cache.

The key was being mangled with sha1, which is known for having
collision issues. The mangling algorithm is changed to use
sha512. Also, short strings are not mangled.

Closes-Bug: 1600393
Closes-Bug: 1600395
Closes-Bug: 1605355
Closes-Bug: 1609566

Change-Id: Ifcb2378ba233d48c3b15dd3ba96c38818288074f
'}]
commit_message:
Use sha512 when mangling keys to avoid collisions

Deployers are seeing issues when enabling caching where for some
reason unexpected values are being returned. This may be because
there is a collision in the mangled key when there are lots of
values stored in the cache.

The key was being mangled with sha1, which is known for having
collision issues. The mangling algorithm is changed to use
sha512. Also, short strings are not mangled.

Closes-Bug: 1600393
Closes-Bug: 1600395
Closes-Bug: 1605355
Closes-Bug: 1609566

Change-Id: Ifcb2378ba233d48c3b15dd3ba96c38818288074f

commit_message:
Update middlewarearchitecture for paste config

Configuring auth_token middleware using the paste config file is
deprecated so the documentation should say to use the
application's .conf file primarily and that the paste config file
is only for backwards compatiblity.

Change-Id: I2b5717ea0a7083bc52b9d4e1d21c2cbfcee136d6

commit_message:
Adding spec for supporting multiple secret store backends

Updated patch to clarify review comments and correct typos.
Added details around plugin name and how its used in secret_stores
'name' field.

Added changes related to how multiple plugin configuration is going to
be specified and used.

Added field to capture crypto_plugin name in addition to secret store plugin
name. This is done as both software only and pkcs11 plugin uses database
(store_crypto) as storage backend. Difference is in crypto plugin used
(simple crypto vs p11_crypto).

APIImpact
SecurityImpact

Change-Id: I02054d80f68f38145b399909d60db80a4d91c1ba

commit_message:
Correctly handle get_network_role_property results

The Puppet function get_network_role_property() can return NIL if the
role not found, so we should correctly handle these cases.

Change-Id: Ia4cd0a4668c6f1e18725e47ea8764b0dfb532c1d

subject: Created DSVM Job for NPM Projects
revisions:
[{'number': 15, 'created': '2016-08-18 20:27:34.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/macros.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/javascript.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': "Created DSVM Job for NPM Projects

Create a devstack environment against which a nodejs project may
be tested. Pre and post hooks are delegated directly to npm via
custom commands, which can be configured per job. The Post hook
additionally is passed the path to devstack's generated 'clouds.yaml'
file, which contains credentials for an admin, a non-admin, and
an alternate user.

Example format:

clouds:
  devstack:
    auth: ...
  devstack-admin:
    auth: ...
  devstack-alt:
    auth: ...

Co-Authored-By: Corentin Ardeois <cardeois@internap.com>
Change-Id: I48624786cc5dacf7d94653c0ce269236ba8c442c
"}]
commit_message:
Created DSVM Job for NPM Projects

Create a devstack environment against which a nodejs project may
be tested. Pre and post hooks are delegated directly to npm via
custom commands, which can be configured per job. The Post hook
additionally is passed the path to devstack's generated 'clouds.yaml'
file, which contains credentials for an admin, a non-admin, and
an alternate user.

Example format:

clouds:
  devstack:
    auth: ...
  devstack-admin:
    auth: ...
  devstack-alt:
    auth: ...

Co-Authored-By: Corentin Ardeois <cardeois@internap.com>
Change-Id: I48624786cc5dacf7d94653c0ce269236ba8c442c

subject: Fix Influx statistics and Alarm History behavior
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2419, 'name': 'Roland Hochmuth', 'email': 'roland.hochmuth@hpe.com', 'username': 'roland-hochmuth-s'}, {'_account_id': 11809, 'name': 'Craig Bryant', 'email': 'craig.bryant@hpe.com', 'username': 'craig-bryant'}, {'_account_id': 14517, 'name': 'Ryan Brandt', 'email': 'ryan.brandt@hpe.com', 'username': 'ryan-brandt'}, {'_account_id': 15027, 'name': 'Michael Hoppal', 'email': 'michael.jam.hoppal@hpe.com', 'username': 'michael-hoppal'}, {'_account_id': 16168, 'name': 'Tomasz Trębski', 'email': 'kornicameister@gmail.com', 'username': 'trebskit'}, {'_account_id': 18179, 'name': 'Kaiyan Sheng', 'email': 'kaiyan.sheng@hpe.com', 'username': 'kaiyan-sheng'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 13, 'created': '2016-08-18 22:30:12.000000000', 'files': ['monasca_tempest_tests/tests/api/test_statistics.py', 'monasca_tempest_tests/tests/api/base.py', 'java/src/main/java/monasca/api/infrastructure/persistence/influxdb/InfluxV9StatisticRepo.java', 'java/src/test/java/monasca/api/infrastructure/persistence/PersistUtilsTest.java', 'monasca_api/common/repositories/influxdb/metrics_repository.py', 'java/src/main/java/monasca/api/infrastructure/persistence/PersistUtils.java', 'monasca_tempest_tests/tests/api/test_alarms_state_history_one_transition.py'], 'message': 'Fix Influx statistics and Alarm History behavior

Fix influx statistics query to include the timestamp offset

Fix monasca_tempest_tests.tests.api.test_statistics.TestStatistics.test_list_statistics_with_offset_limit by
assuming offset is an opaque value and making sure it is urldecoded and urlencoded as it should be. Also,
previously, the test was trying to use an offset returned by measurement-list and apply it to metric-statistics.
That is not required to work by the API definition and should not be attempted

There was a bug in the Java parsing of timestamps which was causing
2016-08-05T17:33:13.310Z to be converted to 2016-08-05T17:33:13.031Z. This caused
Alarm Histories to be appear to be out of order which caused the tests to fail randomly.
Fixed that bug and added unit tests

Change-Id: Iedccae6584e01c56cc05dcc45f9b124cb7d61109
'}]
commit_message:
Fix Influx statistics and Alarm History behavior

Fix influx statistics query to include the timestamp offset

Fix monasca_tempest_tests.tests.api.test_statistics.TestStatistics.test_list_statistics_with_offset_limit by
assuming offset is an opaque value and making sure it is urldecoded and urlencoded as it should be. Also,
previously, the test was trying to use an offset returned by measurement-list and apply it to metric-statistics.
That is not required to work by the API definition and should not be attempted

There was a bug in the Java parsing of timestamps which was causing
2016-08-05T17:33:13.310Z to be converted to 2016-08-05T17:33:13.031Z. This caused
Alarm Histories to be appear to be out of order which caused the tests to fail randomly.
Fixed that bug and added unit tests

Change-Id: Iedccae6584e01c56cc05dcc45f9b124cb7d61109

commit_message:
Add  docstrings for hacking.translation_checks

Cleaning up a little technical debt by adding docstrings
for our public APIs.

For hacking checks we use the pep8 docstring format [1] so
that the pep8 check codes can be auto-detected by pep8.
I've manually tested neutron-lib master + this change with
neutron master to ensure pep8 for neutron has no impacts.

Note: I plan to submit a patch per file as part of this bug work.
These patches won't depend on each other. The last patch of
the series will close the bug.

[1] https://github.com/PyCQA/pycodestyle/blob/1.5.7/pep8.py#L100

Change-Id: I5301c105b60a4f61e2a220d0eb11c611a367c1cf
Partial-Bug: #1614594

environments used for post jobs (as constraints aren't supported there
yet).

This also doesn't enable constraints for our image builds, as it isn't
possible to pass an environment variable into the Dockerfile to allow
folks to choose their own constraints file (and we don't want to force

commit_message:
Use constraints for all the things

This configures tox to use upper-constraints for everything, except
environments used for post jobs (as constraints aren't supported there
yet).

This also doesn't enable constraints for our image builds, as it isn't
possible to pass an environment variable into the Dockerfile to allow
folks to choose their own constraints file (and we don't want to force
people to rely on git.o.o for building images).

Closes-Bug: #1611528
Change-Id: Ic78db2ce5ab516606cbe63c1e35a4d6394367f16
(cherry picked from commit 4e35b0ee64a249c8461efc1c4374dd6cd9253220)

commit_message:
Added revert for Resize

This change adds a revert method for Resize. 'resize_' is prepended
to the VM name during a Resize and if an error occured before
the Resize completes, the prepended 'resize_' was never removed.
This changeset renames the VM to the original name on a Resize
failure.

Change-Id: I7377171edcfb01a216e0fac5e9431fc4ee1c13fa
Closes-Bug: #1610305

commit_message:
Add support for Microsoft DNS Server backend

Currently, there is no support for Microsoft DNS
in designate. This patch addresses this issue
by adding support for Microsoft DNS Server using
an agent backend in designate.

Change-Id: I8db1906e17e5fb20fa6f3e5d1f13b2d701f0c032
Implements: blueprint msdns-backend-support
Depends-On: I029747555a58e0a8e362b65e6c0c470cf2774e42

commit_message:
[install] Block storage node requires python-keystone

On RDO, the cinder volume components on the block storage
node require python-keystone. However, the RDO packages do
not install this package. Thus, we must install it manually.

backport: mitaka
Closes-Bug: #1584665
Change-Id: Iaecc0ad23aeb29154d371446cc57458c605eb545
(cherry picked from commit 7d36a19ee4731170516359e71b4ff0382e367fae)

subject: [networking] Default security group per project not network
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-23 14:53:40.000000000', 'files': ['doc/networking-guide/source/intro-os-networking.rst'], 'message': '[networking] Default security group per project not network

The intro networking guide incorrectly described the default security
group as belonging to a network, rather than a project. If this where
the case, a project would not be able to modify the default security
group for an instance attached to a shared network or another project
could modify the security groups for the instances belonging to the
first project.

backport: mitaka
Change-Id: I6587728bb4c86451fc88d796537ebcae6ed72997
(cherry picked from commit 803dd2712e3b1325a2bad7a6d932c92755e4820e)
'}]
commit_message:
[networking] Default security group per project not network

The intro networking guide incorrectly described the default security
group as belonging to a network, rather than a project. If this where
the case, a project would not be able to modify the default security
group for an instance attached to a shared network or another project
could modify the security groups for the instances belonging to the
first project.

backport: mitaka
Change-Id: I6587728bb4c86451fc88d796537ebcae6ed72997
(cherry picked from commit 803dd2712e3b1325a2bad7a6d932c92755e4820e)
